text: What is the capital of France?
label: Paris

metadata.context: France is a country in Europe. Its capital is Paris.

text: Who wrote Romeo and Juliet?
label: William Shakespeare

metadata.context: Romeo and Juliet is a famous play written by William Shakespeare.

text: What is 2 + 2?

metadata.context: Basic arithmetic: 2 + 2 equals 4.

text: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
label: Jupiter

metadata.context: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.

text: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
label: Leonardo da Vinci

metadata.context: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci.

text: What is the derivative of sin(x)?
label: cos(x)

metadata.context: In differential calculus, the derivative of sin(x) with respect to x is cos(x).

text: Who discovered penicillin?
label: Alexander Fleming

metadata.context: Penicillin was discovered in 1928 by Alexander Fleming.

text: What is 5 factorial?

metadata.context: By definition, 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 120.

text: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?

metadata.context: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, marking the beginning of German reunification.

text: What is the time complexity of binary search on a sorted array?
label: O(log n)

metadata.context: Binary search splits the search interval in half each step, giving logarithmic time complexity.

text: What is the atomic number of carbon?

metadata.context: On the periodic table, carbon has atomic number 6.

text: What is the speed of light in vacuum (m/s)?

metadata.context: By definition, the speed of light in vacuum is exactly 299,792,458 m/s.

text: What does HTTP stand for?
label: Hypertext Transfer Protocol

metadata.context: HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web.

text: What year did Apollo 11 land on the Moon?

metadata.context: Apollo 11 landed on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

text: What is Euler’s identity?
label: e^(iπ) + 1 = 0

metadata.context: Euler’s identity is often cited as an example of mathematical beauty.

text: What is the boiling point of water at sea level (°C)?

metadata.context: At standard atmospheric pressure, water boils at 100 °C.

text: What is the capital of Nigeria?
label: Abuja

metadata.context: Nigeria is a country in West Africa. Its capital is Abuja.

text: What is the capital of Australia?
label: Canberra

metadata.context: Australia’s capital city is Canberra.

text: What is the capital of Japan?
label: Tokyo

metadata.context: Japan’s capital city is Tokyo.

text: What is the square root of 81?

metadata.context: The square root of 81 is 9.

text: What is the value of π to two decimal places?

metadata.context: Pi (π) is approximately 3.14159…, which rounds to 3.14 at two decimal places.

text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a triangle in degrees?

metadata.context: In Euclidean geometry, the interior angles of any triangle add up to 180 degrees.

text: Solve for x: x² - 4 = 0
label: x = 2 or x = -2

metadata.context: The equation x² - 4 = 0 factors to (x - 2)(x + 2) = 0, so x = 2 or x = -2.

text: How many seconds are in one hour?

metadata.context: 60 seconds × 60 minutes = 3600 seconds in one hour.

text: How many minutes are in a day?

metadata.context: 24 hours × 60 minutes = 1440 minutes in a day.

text: How many hours are in a week?

metadata.context: 7 days × 24 hours = 168 hours in a week.

text: How many months have 31 days?

metadata.context: January, March, May, July, August, October, and December each have 31 days.

text: Which galaxy is Earth located in?
label: The Milky Way

metadata.context: Our Solar System resides in the Milky Way galaxy.

text: What is the formula for kinetic energy?
label: ½mv²

metadata.context: Kinetic energy is defined as one-half mass times velocity squared.

text: What is Newton’s second law of motion?
label: F = ma

metadata.context: Newton’s second law states that force equals mass times acceleration.

text: What is the standard acceleration due to gravity on Earth (m/s²)?

metadata.context: Standard gravity is defined as 9.81 m/s².

text: Which formula expresses mass–energy equivalence?
label: E = mc²

metadata.context: Einstein’s mass–energy equivalence formula is E = mc².

text: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
label: Mitochondria

metadata.context: Mitochondria generate most of the cell’s supply of ATP and are known as the powerhouse of the cell.

text: What molecule carries genetic information in most living organisms?
label: DNA

metadata.context: Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) holds genetic blueprints for living organisms.

text: Who wrote the novel 1984?
label: George Orwell

metadata.context: 1984 is a dystopian novel authored by George Orwell and published in 1949.

text: Who wrote To Kill a Mockingbird?
label: Harper Lee

metadata.context: To Kill a Mockingbird is a Pulitzer Prize–winning novel by Harper Lee.

text: Who was the first President of the United States?
label: George Washington

metadata.context: George Washington served as the first U.S. President from 1789 to 1797.

text: In which year did World War I begin?

metadata.context: World War I started on July 28, 1914.

text: In which year did World War II end?

metadata.context: World War II concluded on September 2, 1945.

text: What is the smallest country in the world by area?
label: Vatican City

metadata.context: Vatican City covers about 44 hectares and is the world’s smallest independent state.

text: Which element has the chemical symbol Au?
label: Gold

metadata.context: Au comes from the Latin name aurum for the metal gold.

text: What does GDP stand for?
label: Gross Domestic Product

metadata.context: GDP measures the total market value of all final goods and services produced in a country.

text: What is the currency of Japan?
label: Yen

metadata.context: The official currency of Japan is the Yen (¥).

text: What is the output of print(len([1, 2, 3])) in Python?

metadata.context: len([1, 2, 3]) returns the number of items in the list, which is 3.

text: In Python, what keyword is used to define a function?
label: def

metadata.context: The def keyword introduces a function definition in Python.

text: In JavaScript, what keyword declares a variable with block scope?
label: let

metadata.context: let declares a block-scoped local variable in JavaScript.

text: What is the average-case time complexity of quicksort?
label: O(n log n)

metadata.context: Quicksort on average partitions arrays in half each recursion, yielding O(n log n).

text: If P implies Q and Q implies R, does P imply R?
label: Yes

metadata.context: By transitivity of implication, if P ⇒ Q and Q ⇒ R, then P ⇒ R.

text: If all cats are mammals and some mammals are black, can we conclude that some cats are black?
label: No

metadata.context: The premises do not guarantee any overlap between cats and the subset of black mammals.

text: What is the binary representation of decimal 10?

metadata.context: 10 in base-10 converts to 1010 in base-2.

text: In git, what command stages changes for commit?
label: git add

metadata.context: git add adds changes in the working directory to the staging area.

text: What is Big O notation used for?
label: Describing algorithm complexity

metadata.context: Big O notation characterizes an algorithm’s performance in terms of input size.
